Package edu.csueastbay.cs401.ejamdar

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
edu.csueastbay.cs401.ejamdar.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GameController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
GameController is the FXML class that assists with adding elements to the screen as well as overall directing how GUI elements are show and how GUI events are handled.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Eshaq Jamdar
See Also:

      public GameController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Method initialize will start the JavaFX scene

      Initialize will first play the background song, make a new instance of game, put the game in focus, add the elements of the field and sets up the timeline.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      url - of type URL
      resourceBundle - of type ResourceBundle
      See Also:
      • GameController

    • addGameElementsToField

      private void addGameElementsToField()
      Method addGameElementsToField will add the pucks for the game onto the screen

      Method will obtain the pucks arraylist and loop through every puck and add it to the field. In addition, it will also add any other game objects such as paddles.

      See Also:
      • GameController

    • backgroundMusic

      public void backgroundMusic(int num)
      Method backgroundMusic Will take in a number and based off it, play the correct sound.

      Method takes in a number and depending on it, will play it. Choice 1 will play the background song, choice 2 plays the point award sfx and choice 3 will play the paddle/wall hitting sound.

      Parameters:
      num - represents the sound file to be played: int
      See Also:
      • GameController

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Method keyPress will print out the clicked keyPress to the console (debug)

      Method will print to the screen the keyPress and then register the keyPress with the instance of JamdarPong to register user input.

      Parameters:
      event - of type KeyEvent representing an ASCII value on the keyboard.
      See Also:
      • GameController

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Method keyReleased will print out the clicked keyRelease to the console (debug)

      Ditto to the previous method but with the key that was let go.

      Parameters:
      event - of type KeyEvent representing an ASCII value on the keyboard.
      See Also:
      • GameController

    • setUpTimeline

      private void setUpTimeline()
      Method setUpTimeLine will help with initializing the initial screen

      Method will make a new Timeline and from there, call upon a helper function handle that will setScore for both players to their initial value of 0 and start the movement in the game.

      See Also:
      • GameController

    • mute

      void mute(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method mute will mute every instance of MediaPlayer

      Method will check if the mediaPlayer is currently on and if so, pause the instances of mediaPlayer. If the button is pressed and it is off, it is turned back on. NOTE: Only mutes the stage music and not the sfx of the paddles or points.

      Parameters:
      event - representing event based actions from the GUI
      See Also:
      • GameController

    • exit

      void exit(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Method exit will exit gracefully from the program

      Method will stop the mediaPlayer from playing and will take the current source window and close the stage NOTE: This may not be a proper close cause the sound effects for paddle and the puck continue to play unless both windows are closed.

      Parameters:
      event - representing event based actions from the GUI
      Throws:
      IOException
      See Also:
      • GameController
